text.content:
Level

Name

Description

Link

8

Aboleth

Enormous, antediluvian catfish covered in slime and tentacles. They hate all intelligent beings.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.sgVqRuCaadRK1P7R]{Link}

1

Acolyte

A religious trainee who knows basic rites and rituals.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.k2YdCMGiq3USE8oE]{Link}

9

Angel, Domini

Winged, flawless humans glowing with bronze sunlight.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.63d5P0opwEQTdDIn]{Link}

11

Angel, Principi

Serene humans sculpted from alabaster. Golden orbs for eyes.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.X8hc2Uhflvy8F634]{Link}

3

Angel, Seraph

Beautiful, luminous humanoids with white-feathered wings.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.9mHBuBhx1RxUdheA]{Link}

2

Animated Armor

An old suit of armor magically animated by a vengeful spirit.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.qSeHWgP59WltutCz]{Link}

3

Ankheg

Horse-sized, rust-brown insects. They burrow vast, underground warrens into the bedrock.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.rrI5NuJ8q0Pm4ehs]{Link}

2

Ape

Hooting, omnivorous apes that live in trees.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.52p2phLsOZiNFTFS]{Link}

4

Ape, Snow

White-haired, carnivorous gorillas that stalk the high mountains and live in caves.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.z4UPCFgmpXHwzmJu]{Link}

1

Apprentice

A cloaked magician with a thin, freshly bound spellbook.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.9R3qr0129OxaXMcy]{Link}

16

Archangel

A radiant being with a crown of fire, snowy wings, golden armor, and a blazing greatsword.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.GzjB5DsORxRuX2MV]{Link}

16

Archdevil

A stunningly beautiful, horned human with burning, red eyes and a halo of seven black stars. Two stitched-up gashes weep blood from its shoulder blades.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.OkhcwZ7JqJxTgkJo]{Link}

10

Archmage

A wizened magic-user crackling with arcane power.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.5NUw5FTgSVwAi0nL]{Link}

8

Assassin

A black-cloaked, skulking killer.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.I5y9YDSIg2n0u8CM]{Link}

3

Azer

Dwarves with bronze, metallic skin and flames in place of hair. Gifted blacksmiths.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.rEhCGVPPzY0R18oJ]{Link}

1

Badger

Fierce, clawed burrowers with black-and-white face stripes.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.VM65vWCNjlx5tKTP]{Link}

1

Bandit

Hard-bitten rogue in tattered leathers and a hooded cloak.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.AMSI3MCLvpcZpJPO]{Link}

5

Basilisk

Massive, muscled lizards with six legs and gray, tough hide.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.r9PchmCuVg1r9FOA]{Link}

2

Bat, Giant

Leathery, eagle-sized mammal with a taste for flesh.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.EJ94w4A9mb9ETSGA]{Link}

4

Bat, Swarm

A whirling cloud of screeching, bloodthirsty bats.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.CUpk1oMNktqZPdXp]{Link}

5

Bear, Brown

A hulking, swaying brute with claws as long as a finger.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.RG84tprafQTDEFCa]{Link}

7

Bear, Polar

A mighty, white bear that thrives in arctic environments.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.A84XNl4aGBeeDDLu]{Link}

1

Beastman

A cave hominid with scraggly fur and a stone-tipped spear.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{Link}

2

Berserker

Howling, battleraging warriors.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.dqWmtEZjAMQLmCBn]{Link}

6

Black Pudding

A black, ice-cold mass of sludge.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.LjwxMX3llNTrJk78]{Link}

3

Boar

Ornery wild pig with bristly, russet hair and yellowed tusks.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.bXYsB2bHIdtOsZgV]{Link}

1

Brachiosaurus

Colossal, long-necked tree grazers. Slow and peaceful.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.P3UFDBgbA5kkwcYb]{Link}

8

Brain Eater

Purple, gaunt humanoids with squidlike heads and four face tentacles. They live in complex, alien societies underground and eat humanoid brains.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.MnV9R6AbzWjLreaZ]{Link}

3

Bugbear

Brutish, bat-eared goblinoids covered in brown fur.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.qUuNdFtYmo1vXVP5]{Link}

8

Bulette

A hulking, shark-sized lizard with a steely, arrow-shaped carapace and a massive gullet.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.ktpbMeq6xDzNbOu3]{Link}

2

Camel

Ornery, tan-furred desert beasts.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.JO2HwD53QhEuV3W9]{Link}

6

Cave Brute

A hulking, insectoid beast with long mandibles, four eyes, and thick arms covered in bristles.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.nhKDBbnOnXXTzfBr]{Link}

4

Cave Creeper

Chittering, green centipedes the size of horses. Their grasping tentacles are coated in a paralytic venom.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.j7sQ6Km2jSx5twCC]{Link}

3

Centaur

Herd-dwelling beings with the upper body of a human and lower body of a horse.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.5AV9DF5BbMu7mvVO]{Link}

1

Centipede, Giant

Blood-red, feathery centipedes the size of a human arm. Their bite injects a burning poison that cramps muscles.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.W9n69R2FY4EIgBuQ]{Link}

4

Centipede, Swarm

A crawling mass of weaving, sinuous centipedes.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.lcqq47H1YVF0ABnp]{Link}

10

Chimera

A monstrous beast with a half-goat, half-lion body, wide dragon wings, and the heads of a goat, lion, and dragon.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.5SaVYhtOSTOUcHCV]{Link}

5

Chuul

Brown, horse-sized lobster bugs with tentacles and pincers.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.4v8PY6yOUcQOTWWo]{Link}

6

Cloaker

A midnight blue manta ray with a bony tail and crescent-shaped maw above its belly. It swoops through deep, lightless caverns.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.SeY0lvD3U4pr6mXD]{Link}

3

Cockatrice

A molting, lizard-chicken hybrid with a crimson, razorlike crest.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.xUxKG0CR6Elw1l7h]{Link}

9

Couatl

A human-sized snake with scales made of jewels and a corona of iridescent feathers.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.ibQF9DMmu8sTLz4B]{Link}

5

Crab, Giant

A wagon-sized, armored crab with two crushing pincers.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.2KRkhIG0f9YAnUHb]{Link}

4

Crocodile

Fat, scaly reptiles with stumpy legs and long, thrashing tails.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.obS0HaAx233uar7B]{Link}

2

Cultist

A cloaked, wild-eyed zealot chanting the guttural prayers of a dark god.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.CpHttsoemSoZRiDe]{Link}

8

Cyclops

Reclusive, one-eyed giants towering 20' high. They live simply on remote farmlands.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.68wDauouPEUU9oMR]{Link}

1

Darkmantle

A floating, black octopus with rows of red eyes and a webbed skirt of tentacles.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.0JAEN5FsKjaXXZaA]{Link}

2

Deep One

Cultish, amphibious fish-people with bulbous eyes. They lurk in deep water and sunless caverns.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.5J7IfGiC6Za14VuU]{Link}

16

Demon, Balor

Colossal, horned bat-beasts wreathed in the flames of hell itself. Their mighty swords and cracking whips of fire can slice through stone.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.ju93VWtuoi9BRX5F]{Link}

2

Demon, Dretch

Green, pig-faced demons with thick claws and an oily stench.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.UzRHO1MCMmYDSVzo]{Link}

8

Demon, Glabrezu

Horse-headed, fanged creatures who walk upright and have four arms; two shriveled, and two ending in hulking pincers.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.CuwjaziXY6YoAg7O]{Link}

9

Demon, Marilith

Hissing, armored women with six limbs and the lower bodies of giant snakes. Six whirling blades flash in their hands.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.P53eJcTVm4axJ2bR]{Link}

5

Demon, Vrock

Wagon-sized, filthy vultures with four limbs, midnight-blue skin, and a rash of mangy feathers.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.0Q9d1621wpUEsuFC]{Link}

3

Devil, Barbed

Lanky, green-mottled fiends bristling with hooked spines.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.n4liAI4qBGY4orA4]{Link}

6

Devil, Cubi

Entrancing humanoids with bat wings and devilish charm.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.eytIJSxijnY4VZ3U]{Link}

9

Devil, Erinyes

Raven-winged, resplendent beings in polished, black armor and helms with curved horns.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.8Lma2TIrsJc0IJzV]{Link}

7

Devil, Horned

Iron-scaled hellions as big as ogres with weighty ram horns, lashing tails, and leathery wings. They are opportunistic and craven in battle.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.TWzBMX1oWU10HBOW]{Link}

2

Devil, Imp

Cat-sized, red devils with oversized wings and tail, tiny horns, and cowardly demeanors.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.qhy4sxYqEkl171L5]{Link}

10

Djinni

Azure-blue, jovial humanoids made of air and roiling wind. Infused with potent magic.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.ytftI0motwEnF29v]{Link}

4

Doppelganger

Gray, featureless humanoids that delight in sowing chaos.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.6ldPPlMIMSd4ALoZ]{Link}

13

Dragon, Desert

The smell of ozone precedes this desert-dwelling dragon. Its dazzling scales of brass and lapis lazuli shimmer in the baking heat.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.3ao87kQaYih26b9q]{Link}

17

Dragon, Fire

Blood-red scales cover the hide of this mighty, volcanic wyrm. Leaping flames glow at the back of its throat.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.8nKQ8hgoWY7vZHb4]{Link}

12

Dragon, Forest

The smell of wet loam follows this dragon. Its jade scales bristle with barbed thorns.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.GGiSjGtAWFwFT81z]{Link}

14

Dragon, Frost

Prismatic ice lines the horns, spines, and wings of this pearly dragon. Clouds of steam hiss from its ice-rimed jaws.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.CUMRox407hfN6Ho1]{Link}

16

Dragon, Sea

A warm sea breeze blows around this amphibious, gold- scaled wyrm. A beard of tendrils covers its snout, and a blue mane billows along its neck.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.wGmyKKVD5P4oE4RD]{Link}

12

Dragon, Swamp

This black, wingless beast slithers through dank swamps.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.KKc8fESqPDECz0bL]{Link}

2

Drow

A graceful, shadowy elf that pounces like a spider.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.OQKt55SQZZUZhlNq]{Link}

6

Drow, Drider

A monstrosity with the body of a giant spider and torso of a drow.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.DttbFgMrxQulVKEf]{Link}

6

Drow, Priestess

A statuesque female drow with a crown of metal spider webs and an imperious gaze.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.mLujryShxJUk5Jys]{Link}

7

Druid

A wizard of the wilds holding a knotted staff and wearing a mossy cloak of deep viridian.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.xwdLsiejN4nayUR5]{Link}

4

Dryad

A coy, emerald-skinned fey covered in leaves. It bonds with and protects a tree.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.vXaqgfDykZPdXnIm]{Link}

2

Duergar

Gray-skinned, greedy dwarves with bald pates and white beards. They dwell in somber castles deep within the earth filled with stolen treasures and enslaved prisoners.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.B1B7yApS28xtu8HN]{Link}

2

Dung Beetle, Giant

A trundling, barrel-sized beetle with a T-shaped horn.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.99s2guSyYKPWp1oy]{Link}

9

Efreeti

Blood-red, towering humanoids formed of lava and ash. Short, black horns and snarling grins.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.o1aBfxHFxYVHLTRn]{Link}

9

Elemental, Air (Greater)

A howling tornado of wind.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.adojju5DJl1iWEg4]{Link}

6

Elemental, Air (Lesser)

A howling tornado of wind.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.XEFAKSOcCUd8G89y]{Link}

9

Elemental, Earth (Greater)

A thundering pillar of earth.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.w14e0EzbGfvjkbes]{Link}

6

Elemental, Earth (Lesser)

A thundering pillar of earth.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Puc0P5lO6IphdIQP]{Link}

9

Elemental, Fire (Greater)

A roaring column of flames.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.V1wcRoUEnIbaNjXN]{Link}

6

Elemental, Fire (Lesser)

A roaring column of flames.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.vylW8UYkC5i9wAS7]{Link}

9

Elemental, Water (Greater)

A crashing vortex of water.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Fb4nfQoOqplwmGHe]{Link}

6

Elemental, Water (Lesser)

A crashing vortex of water.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.ZP1OsAWwqVppLts0]{Link}

7

Elephant

Mighty mammals with tough hide, flappy ears, and a trunk.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Ezs7usvuZdG6zMAL]{Link}

2

Elf

Ethereal, ageless fey-people infused with ancient magic.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.GvxrOdZ1MejJL8DV]{Link}

3

Ettercap

Bipedal, eight-eyed spiderfolk with spindly legs and purple fur.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.fcgq7uwsJEMMdRNx]{Link}

1

Fairy

Miniature fey folk with fluttering moth or butterfly wings.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.RAEbIzHkREYWKvLh]{Link}

2

Frog, Giant

Human-sized frogs with warty skin and long, sticky tongues.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.mpdnvoVyYfvu8yLP]{Link}

4

Gargoyle

Leering, winged fiends that look like stone statues. They can hold perfectly still for long stretches of time.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.FeQJTjVbjxIH6uHd]{Link}

5

Gelatinous Cube

A translucent cube of slime that silently mows through tunnels.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.udRspLiTyURGmLav]{Link}

4

Ghast

Greater ghouls who retain the intelligence they had in life.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.XNiuEhf8QpfOnVCJ]{Link}

6

Ghost

A wavering spirit with a face contorted in rage or sadness.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.LV2ZWlK1qUQz5J4K]{Link}

2

Ghoul

Gray-skinned, slavering undead with whipping tongues and flat, reptilian faces.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.aJPxeuzZ597SWMES]{Link}

10

Giant, Cloud

Pale, angular giants with blue-gray hair, light eyes, and silk robes. They do not allow outsiders into their enclaves.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.vdCzdpAsjmYTa1ps]{Link}

9

Giant, Fire

Bulky, muscled giants with coppery skin and red hair. Heavily armored in iron plate mail studded with bronze rivets.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.PzLMBzFtioZhBlTq]{Link}

9

Giant, Frost

Blue-skinned warriors with broad shoulders and braided hair. They sound war horns during their frequent raids to pillage nearby settlements.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Om5RbAEQDbXI8MwN]{Link}

8

Giant, Goat

Highland-dwelling, barbaric giants with goatlike legs, horns, and horizontal pupils.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.KFCqi1XnRQM7kZyj]{Link}

7

Giant, Hill

Fleshy hulks with leathery skin and broad, sloping foreheads. Cruel, boorish, and dim-witted.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.sFz8XfLheORSuxxM]{Link}

8

Giant, Stone

Lean, sinewy giants with stony skin and deep-set eyes. They are quiet and poised, often sitting motionless for days at a time.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.zIaJgXifG1mIY7FM]{Link}

12

Giant, Storm

Regal titans with sea-green skin, flowing white hair, and thundering voices. They breathe water as easily as air.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.owL9cUM2LTVpMarQ]{Link}

4

Gibbering Mouther

Crawling masses of slime with dozens of screeching, lipless mouths and wet eyeballs.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.8aDS9mPcNoxNc3Ha]{Link}

3

Gladiator

Veteran warriors seasoned in arena fights to the death.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.14gxjungNSpJTf3w]{Link}

2

Gnoll

Barbaric, opportunistic hyena-folk who range in large packs.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.d2dPYSjcZhR5psLj]{Link}

3

Gnome, Deep

Gray-skinned, white-haired fey the size of halflings. They hunt for gems and rare cave flora.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.WMw4J1wECaLGf3Am]{Link}

1

Goblin

A short, hairless humanoid with green skin and pointy ears.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.I7CMFbyFmFHVwE5U]{Link}

4

Goblin, Boss

A scarred goblin with knotted muscles and a crown of iron.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.R3CMnUkD0AVVkjuZ]{Link}

4

Goblin, Shaman

A swaying, chanting goblin wearing necklaces of teeth and a robe of musty rat pelts.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Ot77aKKqmML8yboF]{Link}

8

Golem, Clay

A towering, faceless humanoid shaped from glistening clay.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.y8O1UJWvVI7fDXpn]{Link}

7

Golem, Flesh

A ghastly monstrosity made of sewn-together corpses.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.IDgaXGnSleQcfAwm]{Link}

10

Golem, Iron

A bulky iron suit that squeals and sparks with each step.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.KZNQRwpG4DaN57zB]{Link}

8

Golem, Stone

A wide-limbed, lumbering statue that shakes the ground.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.zLDg6vIYEj4wB0lQ]{Link}

7

Gorgon

A snorting bull made entirely of iron plating. A cloud of green fog billows from its nostrils.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.c9n0i79sjiUWwkiV]{Link}

4

Gorilla

Mighty, jungle-dwelling apes.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.cfdlaAx4balFmIb4]{Link}

2

Gray Ooze

Slick puddles the color of stone.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.04acXEvbSpXQ1NjS]{Link}

4

Grick

A huge worm with four suckered tentacles and a snapping beak.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.Jn5JjEPCUT86txAg]{Link}

4

Griffon

Winged hunters with the head of an eagle and body of a lion. Their favored food is horses.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.72LUt9AEysl22JGv]{Link}

9

Grimlow

A tall, oval-shaped mammal. A giant, half-moon maw hides on its belly beneath its gray fur.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.A6QrevZXpJ0SeiIv]{Link}

1

Guard

A sentry equipped with sturdy weapons and armor.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.unySR92Si932s01C]{Link}

8

Hag, Night

A purple-skinned, stooped woman with stringy, white hair and a mouth full of iron teeth.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.hi47xC8rfvviBoOO]{Link}

6

Hag, Sea

A green, sunken-faced woman. Seaweed hair and oozing flesh.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.vSA5WApOVd99itBh]{Link}

6

Hag, Weald

Eyes dark as moonless nights, skin made of rotting wood, hair of tangled roots and vines.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.9q5O77FFFJ7pTjhL]{Link}

3

Harpy

Horrific, winged women with vulture-like lower bodies. They keen a hypnotic song.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.CsQXDNmBDfao8hij]{Link}

4

Hell Hound

Black wolfhounds with red eyes and jaws dripping with flames.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.PAb9czULqynbNnKj]{Link}

3

Hippogriff

Fierce, winged creatures with the lower body of a horse and upper body of a giant eagle.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.SgSkMF7D9BE69ubm]{Link}

5

Hippopotamus

Ornery river-beasts as large as cows with round, purple bodies and bulbous snouts.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.WI7Tq6Vf2vmgBKcN]{Link}

2

Hobgoblin

A sturdy, tall goblin with russet skin. Militant and strategic.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.uqHIz56KiBwTnbTJ]{Link}

2

Horse

Powerful, swift herd animals that roam open plains.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.olqRJQaOKMLkESQN]{Link}

2

Hydra

A towering, amphibious reptile with a bouquet of snake heads writhing on long necks.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.hr2wYwBcd0WuJWK8]{Link}

6

Invisible Stalker

Intelligent creatures made of flowing air. Often bound to the bidding of evil sorcerers for their peerless tracking ability.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.3cz1ScEh3YlMU1ql]{Link}

0

Jellyfish

Hand-sized, purple sea jellies with stinging tentacles.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.uNah6fsgfkt4Aiet]{Link}

3

Knight

A warrior in shining plate mail and the surcoat of a knightly order.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.BviPIbrJao1ubOX1]{Link}

0

Kobold

Puny, scaled coyote-lizards that dwell underground.

Mordanticus The Flayed

A skinless mummy-lich wearing a crown set with nine bright gems. Once the head of the ancient, wizardly order of Gehemna, Mordanticus now lives in secret within the sanctum of Gehemna's reigning archmage. He has served as an advisor and historian for centuries, but an enduring enchantment prevents him from speaking of two topics: his origins, and The Ten-Eyed Oracle.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.DP8n8iIiU1Qostjv]{Link}

10

Mummy

16

Obe-ixx Of Azarumme

A pale, angular woman in translucent plate mail fashioned from giant scorpion chitin. Obe-Ixx, daughter of Azarumme, rose up from the prehistoric barbarian tribes of Tal-Yool to conquer all in her path. One day, she stood at the steps of an obsidian ziggurat deep within the trackless jungle. Forty nights later, Obe-Ixx emerged as the ur-vampire, bloodlust made flesh. Her dynasty would rise and fall again and again over the coming millennia.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.6ce2xr1QmjJFMe5P]{Link}

Rathgamnon

A pearl-white lion with feathered wings that stands twenty feet tall. Rathgamnon is Madeera the Covenant's mightiest servant; his blank eyes see far into the depths of time and space. He spends all eternity watching the whirl of the stars from the highest mountain in the realm of mortals, waiting for the celestial alignments that prophesy epochs of weal and woe, titanic changes to the balance of power in the cosmos, or threats to the laws of reality itself.

30

The Tarrasque

A colossal, four-legged reptile with crocodilian jaws, amber scales, and a diamond-hard, spiked carapace. It towers overhead like a mountain, able to swallow entire villages in one gulp. The tarrasque hibernates deep in the earth or at the bottom of the sea for centuries, only awakening long enough to fill its vast belly in an indiscriminate rampage of terror and destruction. There is only one tarrasque, and it is the most dreaded creature to walk the earth.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.NTRHmnsw7poR4rZ9]{Link}

18

The Ten-eyed Oracle

A floating mass of rubbery skin crusted with barnacles. Its ten eyestalks writhe like snakes, and a deep, circular scar mars its central body, blinding what was once a large eye above a lipless maw. The Ten-Eyed Oracle stalks the Shadowdark, burbling mad prophesies and somehow moving freely between the lightless fathoms of the earth. The keepers of the deep lore suspect The Ten-Eyed Oracle was once a benevolent ally of mankind, but an unknown calamity drove it to insanity and reckless hatred.

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.hiZvVJPOJWtOXV4m]{Link}

15

The Wandering Merchant

A cheerful merchant who appears to be a hale, middle-aged human man with a handlebar mustache. He wears a white shirt, breeches, and leather apron, and he hauls a towering backpack bursting at the seams. Few know the merchant's true nature and origins, though some theorize he is an immortal being or a god (they are not entirely incorrect). The Wandering Merchant always has something useful, far-flung, or incredible to sell at a reasonable price, and there's no telling when or where he'll show up next...

@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.DbkmPt2k9fw5zxJw]{Link}
